DOC.brief_summary: Measuring sympathetic skin response or heart rate variability can provide an objective biomarker of bladder sensation and its modulation by drug with potential to treat overactive bladder.
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation of the Link Between Bladder Sensation and Changes in Skin Electrical Conductance and Heart Rate.
DOC.detailed_description: Evaluation of the link between bladder sensation and changes in skin electrical conductance and heart rate.
DOC.criteria: Female, healthy volunteers or OAB patients 1865 years old, non pregnant and non lactating History of lower urinary tract pathology Excessive alcohol and tobacco consumption Treatment with investigational drug in the last 30 days Abnormal ECG trace Conditions that would contraindicate the use of tolterodine or any other anti muscarinic agent
